result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford R. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clifford R. Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clifford R. Larson was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Not to have contact with MGH.
Absolute Sobriety.  Subject to testing to determine compliance as required by agent.

records.addlTxt:
8:36 a.m. Defendant Clifford R. Larson in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  ADA Sortedahl addresses ct.  DE pleads G to amended count 1.  Amended Ct 948.40(1)   Ct goes over PQW.  CT finds DE FVI&K enters plea to amended charge and accepts plea.  Count 2 - dismissed.
SENTENCING: impose 9 mo county jail, stayed.  Probation 1 year.  Conditions of prob. obtain assessment for sexual deviation.  No contact with MGH, maintain sobriety, subj to testing as required by agent.  Participate in any programing recommended by agent.  30 days conditional time with huber, fine/cost of $465.60.  The 30 days cond. time will be served within first 90 days of probation sentence.  DNA sample today.  Report to probation today.  No time served.  9:08 adj.
Plea hearing on July 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
